articles.title: VPS Management Basics
articles.content: A VPS (Virtual Private Server) is a virtualized server that provides dedicated resources within a shared physical server. Key management tasks include system updates, security hardening, monitoring, and backup management.

articles.title: Security Hardening Best Practices
articles.content: Essential security measures include: disabling root login, using SSH keys, configuring fail2ban, setting up UFW firewall, regular updates, and monitoring system logs.

articles.title: SSH Key Management
articles.content: SSH keys provide secure authentication. Generate with ssh-keygen, copy with ssh-copy-id, and manage authorized_keys file. Disable password authentication after key setup.

articles.title: System Monitoring Fundamentals
articles.content: Monitor CPU, memory, disk usage, and network. Use tools like htop, iotop, netstat. Set up alerts for critical thresholds. Log analysis is crucial for troubleshooting.
